page.title: 16Basket-making
page.content: Basket-making is a local traditional craft, but there is only one family in the area which relies on basket-making for its income. The baskets are made from willow twigs known as 'withies'. The twigs are light, springy and more resistant to decay in water than most woods. Three basic colours are possible. A chocolate brown colour is acquired by steaming the twigs while they they have the bark on, white ones are produced by removing the bark and a reddish brown tint is achieved by boiling them for a short while before stripping off the bark. Basket-making is a skilled craft and is more than just weaving withies together. However it is a declining industry. Many of the products, such as clothes baskets, can be bought more cheaply made from plastic.
